title: Contingency Tables
body: Suppose we obtain data from $$405$$ people who play "games" at a High School. Of the $$121$$ that prefer games played outside, $$10$$ like to play alone, while the other $$111$$ play with others. Of the $$354$$ people that prefer games played inside, $$245$$ liked to play alone, while the other $$109$$ played with others.
